summary: The Offshore Pipeline Safety Act aims to improve safety and environmental protection related to offshore oil and gas pipelines. The bill mandates updated regulations for pipeline inspections and leak detection, including a timeline for implementation. It also requires a study on the environmental risks of decommissioning pipelines, considerations for decommissioning applications, and ongoing monitoring of decommissioned pipelines. Furthermore, the bill establishes an annual fee on pipeline owners to cover decommissioning costs in case of bankruptcy and addresses exposed pipeline segments. Finally, it mandates a study on the environmental risks of chemical products used in oil and gas operations and requires a report to Congress.
